scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L is a star with 0.23 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 2804.94 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L system


OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L b

OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2018-03, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L b is 4.452 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L b is 1.960 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, and a semi-major axis of 1.18 astronomical units, which is outside the habitable zone of OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L, OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L b is likely an icy world.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2017-BLG-1434L - System With 1 Exoplanet
